verses.roman:
astauṣīd atha viśveśaṁ
devī deva-varārcitam
prāñjaliḥ praṇatā rājan
bhakti-pravaṇayā dhiyā

synonyms: astauṣīt—praised; atha—then; viśva—of the universe; īśam—the Lord; devī—the goddess; deva—of demigods; vara—by the best; arcitam—who is worshiped; prāñjaliḥ—folding her palms; praṇatā—bowed down; rājan—O King (Parīkṣit); bhakti—of devotion; pravaṇayā—full; dhiyā—with a mentality.
translation: O King, after bowing down to Him and then standing with joined palms, the goddess, her mind filled with devotion, began to praise the Lord of the universe, whom the best of demigods worship.
